data.title: Edna Manley & Beres Hammond
data.meta_description:
Edna Manley & Beres Hammond - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Edna Manley was an English-born Jamaican artist and social activist. She moved to Jamaica in 1922 after marrying her cousin Norman Manley. She became a prominent public figure as an artist focused on Jamaican themes and for promoting Jamaican culture through an editorial role. 

Beres Hammond is a renowned Jamaican reggae singer known for his soulful voice and romantic lovers rock style. His career began in the 1970s and he found his greatest success in the 1990s. He has released numerous albums and singles over the decades that have topped charts in Jamaica and gained international recognition.
